html.p: Now it's time to make your decision on which Improvement Goal you will pursue. If you wish to begin by reviewing your pre-goal brainstorm work, you can TODO-LINK (instructions on how to access the Diary area).
(1) Write your goal in a sentence or phrase. Begin with "I am committed to getting better at…" and complete the sentence.

(2) Explain why this goal is important to you. It may seem odd that we are asking you to explain your goal. But what you choose for your Improvement Goal is a crucial part of this process because the entire course hinges on it. No matter how powerful the immunity-to-change process may be, if you are working with a goal that you haven't fully thought through or is not highly important to you, your whole experience is likely to be much weaker.
